scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Information
scopecontent.p: The collection contains mock-ups of book jackets for various books by Auchinloss, a photograph of the author, three postcards from Auchincloss to collector Charles Miller, a letter from Nan A. Talese to Adele Auchincloss concerning cover artwork, and a corrected holograph manuscript, "The Mavericks," probably from "Powers of Attorney."

did.physdesc: AMs, on yellow legal pad paper, 22 pages

scopecontent.p: A discarded and probably re-written chapter from the novel Powers of Attorney by Louis Auchincloss.

did.unittitle: Letter from Nan A. Talese, Executive Editor, to Ms. Adele Auchincloss, New York 1982 Jul 7

scopecontent.p: Nan Talese thanks Auchincloss for sending the watercolors for possible use on the book jacket but favors using an oil painting already in a museum for the cover.

did.unittitle: Letter from Louis Auchincloss, New York, to Charles L. Miller, Jr., West Hartford, Connecticut [1981 Jun 16]

scopecontent.p: Louis Auchincloss furnishes the publishing information for his bibliography L.A. and His Critics.

did.unittitle: Letter from Louis Auchincloss, New York, to Charles L. Miller, Jr., West Hartford, Connecticut [1990 Jul 3]

scopecontent.p: Louis Auchincloss writes concerning Miller's visit to the house built by his grandfather who later sold it to his richer brother, Hugh

did.unittitle: Letter from Louis Auchincloss to Charles L. Miller, Jr., West Hartford, Connecticut n.d.

scopecontent.p: Louis Auchincloss assures Charles L. Miller that he may send any books he wishes to be signed and expresses appreciation for the Vanderbilt piece.
Photograph of Louis Auchincloss, seated in a chair
The Artwork covers art work for various books of Louis Auchincloss, including Narcissa and Other Fables, The Winthrop Covenant, Rector of Justin, and Skinny Island More Tales of Manhattan.
